newsitem.title: UK: Britain confident of successful Hong Kong handover.
newsitem.headline: Britain confident of successful Hong Kong handover.

text.p: The British government said on Tuesday it was confident next June's transfer of Hong Kong sovereignty to China would take place successfully.

Deputy prime minister Michael Heseltine told a meeting of Commonwealth officials that the Commonwealth had "reaffirmed its interest in a successful transition for Hong Kong, and I am very confident that this will be achieved".
"China has too much to lose if Hong Kong's outstanding economic success does not continue," he added.
Hong Kong's six million people will leave the Commonwealth, a grouping made up mainly of Britain and its former colonies and protectorates, when it becomes part of China.
The Commonwealth officials are holding a two-day meeting in London to prepare the ground for a Commonwealth heads of government meeting next October in Edinburgh, Scotland.
